2ed56edeb6669780.question: When a Payment Order for an individual Payment Transaction is transmitted using a Payment Instrument issued under a Framework Contract, which post-initiation information must the Payment Service Provider still provide immediately after initiation, and what category of information may it omit because another Payment Service Provider provides it under Section 19.2?
2ed56edeb6669780.gold_answer: For an individual Payment Transaction sent via a Payment Instrument issued under a Framework Contract, the Payment Service Provider must still provide (or make available) the post-initiation, transaction-specific information immediately after the initiation of the Payment Order to the Payer and, where applicable, to the Payee. [#SRC:a48a07c2-0731-4505-939e-07110e2af622] This includes confirmation that initiation with the Payer’s Payment Service Provider was successful, a reference that lets the Payer and Payee identify the Payment Transaction (including identifying the Payer and Payee and, where appropriate, information transferred with the Payment Order), the transaction amount in the currency used in the Payment Order, any charges payable (and where applicable a breakdown in the Payment Order currency), any exchange-rate details and the post-conversion amount where an exchange rate is used, the date the Payment Service Provider received the Payment Order, and the Credit Value Date. [#SRC:a48a07c2-0731-4505-939e-07110e2af622] However, in this Framework Contract/Payment Instrument scenario, the Payment Service Provider for that single Payment Transaction does not need to provide the “general information” that would otherwise be required under Rule 19.5.1, to the extent that such general information has been provided or will be provided under Section 19.2 by another Payment Service Provider in respect of the Framework Contract. [#TGT:c337e2ea-0d58-45b9-970f-810639f88bf2]
